title: Evidentials
goal: Learn evidentials to express how you know something.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Attitudinal placement review:

.ui mi klama — emotion about ?
mi viska lo .uu gerku — emotion about ?

(Answers: whole situation, the dog)

New Material (5-7 min)

What Are Evidentials?

Evidentials tell HOW you know something — your source of information.

The Five Evidentials

Cmavo Evidence Example
ba'a expectation ba'a do klama (I expect you go)
ti'e hearsay ti'e la .tam. cu snada (I heard Tom succeeded)
za'a observation za'a do klama (I observe you going)
pe'i opinion pe'i ti xamgu (In my opinion, this is good)
ju'o certainty ju'o ti jetnu (Certainly this is true)

Using Evidentials

za'a do klama

I observe/see that you're going.

ti'e la .bob. cu bilma

I heard that Bob is sick. (Someone told me.)

pe'i ti melbi

In my opinion, this is beautiful.

ju'o ti jetnu

I'm certain this is true.

Evidentials vs Attitudinals

Type Expresses
Attitudinals How you FEEL
Evidentials How you KNOW

Key Point

Evidentials mark your source of information: observation, hearsay, opinion, expectation, certainty.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Choose Evidential

Which evidential fits?

  1. I see you going. → ?
  2. Someone told me Bob is sick. → ?
  3. I think this is good. → ?
Answers
  1. za'a do klama
  2. ti'e la .bob. cu bilma
  3. pe'i ti xamgu

Exercise 2: Translate

Translate:

  1. I expect it will rain.
  2. I heard Alice succeeded.
  3. Certainly this is true.
Answers
  1. ba'a lo carvi ba fasnu
  2. ti'e la .alis. cu snada
  3. ju'o ti jetnu

Exercise 3: Report Information

Express these with evidentials:

  1. You see the dog is big. → ?
  2. In your opinion, Lojban is good. → ?
  3. You're certain Bob will come. → ?
Answers
  1. za'a lo gerku cu barda
  2. pe'i la jbobau cu xamgu
  3. ju'o la .bob. ba klama

items.text: Someone told me Bob is sick. → ?
You see the dog is big. → ?
In your opinion, Lojban is good. → ?

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I observe you're going." → za'a do klama
  2. "I heard Tom is sick." → ti'e la .tam. cu bilma
  3. "In my opinion, this is good." → pe'i ti xamgu

Summary

You learned five evidentials: ba'a (expect), ti'e (heard), za'a (observe), pe'i (opine), ju'o (certain).
